item.title: TFS Custom Task - Service Actions (for TFS 2015 Update 2.1 or before)
item.description: Apparently, boolean values for custom VSTS tasks for versions prior to TFS 2015 Update 3) require some special handling as they don’t pass the checkbox values as actual powershell $true or $false. Instead the task passes this information along as true or false. To properly handle this you’ll need to pass in the value as a string then convert to boolean. I found a great start on working on this solution in a blog post by Rene which has more detail, so check it out.
